keyword: how many calories in a pound of hamburger
title: How Many Calories in a Pound of Hamburger?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a pound of hamburger, including full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, protein, fat, and tips for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Pound of Hamburger?
assumptions: Raw ground beef (hamburger), 80% lean / 20% fat, no added seasonings or binders.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fat content, brand, grinding method, and whether raw or cooked; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A pound of 80/20 hamburger meat has about 1153 kcal and 78 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of 80/20 hamburger?
faqs.a: Approximately 1153 kcal for raw 80% lean ground beef.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a pound of hamburger?
faqs.a: About 78 g protein per pound of raw 80/20 hamburger.

faqs.q: Does cooking change calories in hamburger?
faqs.a: Yes, cooking and draining fat reduces calories to around 881 kcal per pound.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: Roughly 90.8 g total fat, with 35 g saturated, in 80/20 raw hamburger.

faqs.q: What if I use leaner hamburger meat?
faqs.a: 90/10 lean drops it to ~756 kcal per pound, with less fat.
